meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a stick or rod.
meanings.sent1: The baculine ruler was used to measure the length of the table.
meanings.sent2: The baculine branches of the tree swayed gently in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The baculine walking stick helped the old man navigate the rocky path.
meanings.sent4: Her baculine posture during the dance made her look elegant and poised.
meanings.sent5: The baculine fence surrounded the garden, adding a rustic charm.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the qualities of a rod or staff.
meanings.sent1: The baculine shape of the building's columns gave it a classical look.
meanings.sent2: The baculine design of the chair's legs provided sturdy support.
meanings.sent3: The baculine appearance of the tree trunk made it seem like a giant pencil.
meanings.sent4: His baculine leadership style guided the team with strength and stability.
meanings.sent5: The baculine structure of the bridge ensured its durability over time.
